intro: Tuberaria annua, commonly known as the annual tufted grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale green florets. The plant produces small, three-angled fruits called caryopses, which are typical of grasses. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other open areas. Tuberaria annua is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
